abstract.text: A container for dynamic shader data associated with a node.

inlineContent.text: SpriteKit nodes that are rendered with a custom shader can use
objects to pass dynamic values which can change without requiring that shader to be recompiled. An attribute value is passed to a shader using a node’s
method using the relevant attribute’s name. For example, given a shader with a
The following code sets the value of this attribute to
, is available as a global floating-point variable within the shader code.
Using this technique, a single shader can be shared across many nodes and each nodes can supply its own attributes. This approach is an alternative to using
objects which would require a recompilation for each distinct set of parameters.

abstract.text: Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.
A specification for dynamic per-node data used with a custom shader.
A container for dynamic shader data associated with a node.
The receiver’s floating point value.
Creates and initializes a new attribute value object
Creates and initializes a new attribute value object that holds a floating point number.
Creates and initializes a new attribute value object that holds a vector of two floating point numbers.
Creates and initializes a new attribute value object that holds a vector of three floating point numbers.
Creates and initializes a new attribute value object that holds a vector of four floating point numbers.
The receiver’s value as a vector of two floating-point numbers.
The receiver’s value as a vector of three floating point numbers.
The receiver’s value as a vector of four floating point numbers.
Sets an attribute value for an attached shader
An object that allows you to apply a custom fragment shader.
An image or solid color.
A container for uniform shader data.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
